review:
Great product in this price range and the best one also .The delivery by
amazon is also very good , I ordered it in the night and got it delivered by
next morning .  
Pros  
1) Great one for smashes.  
2)Great one for drops also.  
3)Light weight .  
Cons  
1) I didn't find any of its cons

First of all, Thanks to Amazon and Cloudtail India for quick and perfect
delivery.  
Product review:Yonex carbonex 7000ex  
I compared it with Yonex Nanoray 6000i and here are my deductions.  
1\. 7000ex is lighter and more handy.  
2.7000ex has a slightly more converging frame  
which results in a smaller 'sweet spot'.  
3.Better than 6000i for placement.  
4.7000ex has literally too much vibration.  
The whole racquet vibrates even for medium powered shots.This was the most
irritating part of the carbonex 7000ex.  
5.The shots were more comfortable to manoeuvre and far more powerful in
Nanoray 6000i than carbonex 7000ex.  
  
I would suggest 7000ex for those who are looking for a handy racquet to work
on their drops and placement.  
Nanoray 6000i is clearly better in terms of power on shots

For beginners say mid beginners too it isn't a perfect buy.  
Specifically the racquet i got it's strings broke in just 3-4 months of play
and now even the handle of racquet has dislocated a bit within just 6 months
of purchase.  
  
And if u have played earlier badminton too and even you are resuming now for
fun or say a routine body maintenance it's comparatively heavy in hand to
deliver smashes and shots swiftly.  
  
I would suggest a complete no for it!!  
Well obvious though it's my personal experience and suggestion.

Perfect balance, right flexibility and weight. Just the right product for
beginners and intermediate players
